name: Swan

faqs.q: How do Swan's bitcoin purchase fees work?
faqs.a: Swan waives fees on your first $10,000 in lifetime buys, then charges 1% on each additional buy or sell. Auto-withdrawals keep Swan Safe custody fees waived so you do not pay the optional 0.03% monthly charge.

faqs.q: When are ACH deposits available to withdraw from Swan?
faqs.a: ACH purchases under $1,000 typically unlock in 10–15 days (closer to 5–10 days once your account is seasoned), while larger ACH purchases unlock in 20–30 days; wires and bitcoin deposits settle within about 24 hours. Use the “Available to withdraw” banner in your dashboard to see exact dates.

faqs.q: Does Swan charge for bitcoin withdrawals?
faqs.a: Swan does not add a platform fee when you withdraw bitcoin; you simply pick the on-chain fee tier that matches the speed you want. USD wires carry a $15 fee with a $50,000 minimum if you move cash instead of bitcoin.

Add a wallet address under Withdrawals, enable two-factor authentication, and set the on-chain balance threshold that fits your cadence. Once your unlocked balance crosses that mark, Swan queues an on-chain withdrawal to that address.

faqs.q: Who holds custody of bitcoin bought on Swan?
faqs.a: Swan opens an individually titled account for you with regulated custodians Bakkt, BitGo, or Equity Trust, and those partners do not lend or rehypothecate customer coins. You can leave funds there temporarily or withdraw to your own wallet whenever you are ready.

fees.intro: Zero-fee onboarding on the first $10,000 in lifetime buys, 1% after that, plus optional custody programs billed separately.

dca: Yes: but with fees after the first $10.000
description:
Swan Bitcoin, launched by Cory Klippsten and based in California, is a platform focused on making it easy for beginners to buy and save Bitcoin.

What makes Swan distinct is its focus on self-custody support and education. It automatically withdraws BTC weekly to your own address and provides guides for self-custody, while also offering Swan Guard with fraud protection and identity verification tools. Swan prioritizes teaching users about Bitcoin's value for financial freedom. Swan also targets long-term savers by offering IRA products making Bitcoin tax-advantaged retirement savings easier.

Swan offers zero-fee purchases on the first $10,000, a low 0.99% fee for recurring buys, and free withdrawals to personal wallets, encouraging self-custody. Its app is praised for its clean design and simple setup. However, some users report slow customer support and issues with account restrictions.

Its vision is to onboard 10 million Bitcoin users by promoting Bitcoin as better money for a decentralized future.
recovery_method: One-time passcode email login with optional authenticator app 2FA.

tl_dr.best_for: Long-term bitcoin buyers who want zero fees on their first $10,000 and concierge paths into self-custody.
tl_dr.consider_if: You value regulated custody partners, Swan Vault backups, or IRA automation alongside recurring buys.
tl_dr.not_ideal_when: You need instant Lightning payments or want to avoid full KYC disclosures.

steps.title: 1. Create & verify
actions: Sign up at swanbitcoin.com or install the Swan app and enter your email to receive a one-time passcode.
Complete identity verification with your legal name, address, and government ID.
Turn on authenticator-based 2FA before funding so withdrawals stay protected.
steps.gotcha: Swan only supports customers over 18 with a U.S. government ID and an eligible bank account.

steps.title: 2. Link your funding
actions: Open the main menu → Bank Accounts and add a U.S. checking account (ACH is required for transfers).
Double-check you entered the ACH routing number rather than the wire routing number.
For large buys, request wire instructions from the Funding section so your bank can send same-day cash.
steps.gotcha: Small fintech banks and savings-only accounts may be rejected by the account verification system.

steps.title: 3. Buy & schedule withdrawal
steps.why: Automate your stacking while keeping a clear exit to self-custody.
actions: Start a one-time or recurring plan; Swan pulls ACH purchases on your chosen cadence.
Watch the “Available to withdraw” timeline so you know when ACH-funded bitcoin unlocks.
Add your wallet in Withdrawals and set auto-withdraw so sats leave custody as soon as they unlock.
steps.gotcha: ACH-funded bitcoin cannot move until its unlock window closes, even if you trigger auto-withdraw.

micro_faqs.q: Can I fund Swan with a savings account?
micro_faqs.a: No. Swan requires a U.S. checking account that supports ACH transfers for recurring buys.

micro_faqs.q: Where do I see my unlock dates?
micro_faqs.a: Open the dashboard banner labeled “Available to withdraw” to view the exact release schedule for each ACH purchase.
Yes. Swan asks you to enable two-factor authentication before it will approve a new withdrawal address or auto-withdraw rule.

fees_scenarios.title: Deposit cash or bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
ACH: free
Wire: free from Swan (your bank may charge)
Bitcoin deposit: network fee only
fees_scenarios.what_happens: ACH trades instantly but unlocks in roughly 10–30 days depending on amount and account history, while wires and bitcoin deposits settle within about 24 hours.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Keep ACH amounts modest while your account is new, use wires for large transfers, and deposit bitcoin directly if you already hold custody.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Unlock timelines appear under the “Available to withdraw” banner in your Swan dashboard.

fees_scenarios.title: Buy bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
First $10,000 lifetime: 0%
After $10,000: 1% per buy or sell
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Swan draws from your linked bank account, executes the buy, and bills trading fees through your bank rather than deducting from your bitcoin.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Batch larger buys into wire transfers, enable recurring plans to stay disciplined, and use auto-withdraw to avoid Swan Safe custody fees.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Fees are charged monthly via ACH once purchases settle and cannot be taken from your bitcoin balance.

fees_scenarios.title: Withdraw bitcoin
fees_scenarios.cost_today:
Bitcoin: mining fee you choose
USD wire: $15 fee (requires $50,000 minimum)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Once funds are unlocked you can trigger a manual send or leave auto-withdraw enabled to move the full balance on-chain.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Plan withdrawals around the unlock calendar, keep a low-fee window open in your wallet, and reserve USD wires for large cash moves.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Auto-withdrawals run on-chain; Swan does not currently offer Lightning withdrawals.

fees_scenarios.title: Keep bitcoin in Swan Safe
fees_scenarios.cost_today: 0.03% of assets per month (waived with auto-withdraw enabled)
fees_scenarios.what_happens: Swan invoices the custody fee via ACH once at least $1 has accrued unless you keep auto-withdraw turned on.
fees_scenarios.how_to_minimize: Enable auto-withdraw, sweep funds to your own wallet, or upgrade to Swan Vault if you want collaborative multisig backups.
fees_scenarios.learn_more: Fees pause automatically when auto-withdraw is turned on or your balance drops below the $1 billing threshold.

fees_faq.a: Trading, Swan Safe, Vault, and IRA fees are debited via ACH from your linked bank account; Swan never pulls them from your bitcoin balance.

fees_faq.q: Does turning on auto-withdraw waive Swan Safe fees?
fees_faq.a: Yes. Swan Safe’s 0.03% monthly charge is automatically waived when you keep auto-withdraw enabled.
Swan Vault runs at 0.02% of assets per month with a $30 minimum and $500 maximum, and includes a complimentary onboarding call.

key_terms.definition: An optional 0.03% monthly custody fee that is waived when you enable auto-withdraw or move funds to self-custody.
The holding period Swan applies to ACH purchases before bitcoin or USD can leave custody; it ranges from 10 to 30 days depending on amount and history.
The on-chain balance level you choose that tells Swan when to queue a full withdrawal to your saved wallet.

methods.name: Bank Transfer (ACH)
methods.best_for: Recurring buys from a U.S. checking account.

limits.withdraw_eligibility: Unlocks in 10–30 days based on amount

methods.name: Wire Transfer
methods.best_for: Large purchases that need faster unlocks than ACH.

limits.withdraw_eligibility: Typically within 24 hours after trade confirmation

methods.name: Bitcoin Deposit
methods.best_for: Moving externally held bitcoin into Swan Vault or Swan Safe.

compat_tiles.title: Swan Vault
compat_tiles.benefit: Assisted multisig security Concierge onboarding call

compat_tiles.title: Swan Guard
compat_tiles.benefit: Segregated custody partners Fraud monitoring & alerts

compat_tiles.title: Dollar-cost averaging (DCA)
compat_tiles.benefit: Daily, weekly, or monthly pulls First $10,000 fee-free

compat_tiles.title: Auto-withdraw
compat_tiles.benefit: Sends full unlocked balance Runs on your schedule

compat_explainers.why: Collaborative multisig keeps your keys offline while Swan guides you through secure storage and inheritance planning.
try: Schedule a Swan Vault onboarding call (included in the fee).
Set up your Jade signing device and register it with the Vault dashboard.
Store your recovery phrases in separate secure locations.
Practice a health check so you can sign independently of Swan if needed.
compat_explainers.gotcha: Swan Vault costs 0.02% per month with a $30 minimum and $500 maximum.

compat_explainers.why: Swan Guard layers fraud detection, withdrawal reviews, and segregated custody so you always know who can touch your bitcoin.
try: Enable authenticator-based 2FA and passkey logins inside Security.
Turn on withdrawal notifications so you see every movement request.
Review the Custody screen to confirm whether Bakkt, BitGo, or Equity Trust holds your account.
compat_explainers.gotcha: Security alerts rely on accurate contact details, so keep your email and phone number current.

compat_explainers.why: Automated buys take the emotion out of stacking while you plan your exit to self-custody.
try: Choose daily, weekly, or monthly frequency from the Buy Bitcoin screen.
Keep ACH limits in mind if you schedule large recurring amounts.
Pair the plan with auto-withdraw so sats leave Swan as soon as they unlock.
compat_explainers.gotcha: After the first $10,000 in lifetime buys, every recurring purchase incurs the 1% trading fee.

compat_explainers.why: Auto-withdraw reduces counterparty risk by moving every unlocked sat to a wallet you control.
try: Add a wallet in Withdrawals and validate the address with 2FA.
Set a threshold that aligns with your fee tolerance (smaller sends cost more in mining fees).
Monitor the queue after each ACH unlock so you know when the transaction broadcasts.
compat_explainers.gotcha: Auto-withdraw only moves unlocked balances; ACH funds still inside the holding window stay custodial until they clear.

tiles.title: 1. Pick a cold storage wallet
tiles.why: Cold storage keeps your bitcoin offline and resistant to hacks.
actions: Choose a hardware or multisig wallet that fits your experience level.
Initialize the device, write down the seed phrase, and store it in two secure places.
Add your wallet software to a trusted computer so you can verify addresses later.
tiles.gotcha: Never store your seed phrase in cloud storage or screenshots; paper or metal backups are safer.

tiles.title: 2. Register a withdrawal address
tiles.why: Registering a fresh address lets Swan route bitcoin directly to your custody.
actions: Open your wallet software and generate a new receive address.
In Swan: go to Withdrawals → Wallets, paste the address, and validate it with 2FA.
Label the wallet so you recognize it during future withdrawals.
tiles.gotcha: If you add an xpub, only use wallets you fully control; custodial wallets can break auto-withdraw rules.

tiles.title: 3. Send a test amount
tiles.why: A small test verifies the address and your signing flow before you move larger balances.
actions: Trigger a manual withdrawal for a small amount and pick the Standard fee tier.
Confirm the transaction in your wallet or on a block explorer.
Wait for confirmation before scheduling larger transfers.
tiles.gotcha: Do not reuse addresses; generate a new one for every withdrawal to improve privacy.

tiles.title: 4. Withdraw the remaining balance
tiles.why: Finishing the withdrawal puts every sat back under your sole control.
actions: Choose the fee tier that fits your urgency: Priority, Standard, or Flexible.
Set or adjust your auto-withdraw threshold so future buys leave custody automatically.
Verify the final transaction and store your hardware wallet securely.
tiles.gotcha: Flexible withdrawals can take up to 24 hours to broadcast; plan ahead if you need faster confirmation.

micro_faqs.q: Can I stop using auto-withdraw after I sweep my balance?
micro_faqs.a: Yes. You can pause auto-withdraw anytime, but leaving it on keeps Swan Safe fees waived and shortens your custodial exposure.

micro_faqs.q: What if I need help recovering a Swan Vault?
micro_faqs.a: Swan Vault includes concierge support and health checks so you can rehearse recovery before you ever need it.

micro_faqs.q: Do I still need Swan Guard after I withdraw?
micro_faqs.a: Swan Guard continues to monitor your account for suspicious logins, but once bitcoin leaves custody those sats live entirely on your hardware wallet.

data_flows: Swan retains your legal name, address, date of birth, and government ID to satisfy AML and KYC obligations.
Connected bank and card data flows through regulated processors so ACH pulls and wires can clear.
Custody partners Bakkt, BitGo, and Equity Trust hold bitcoin in individually titled accounts and do not rehypothecate customer assets.
Cookie preferences control optional analytics and advertising sharing; you can edit them anytime at swan.com/privacy-policy.
privacy.data_flows_do: Review the privacy-policy link and disable non-essential cookies if you prefer not to share behavioral data.
privacy.data_flows_dont: Assume declining cookies removes regulatory obligations; KYC data must be retained regardless of marketing consent.
recovery: Use the emailed one-time passcode to sign in, then add an authenticator app or passkey for stronger protection.
If you lose 2FA access, submit a recovery request with your ID so Swan support can re-enable your account.
privacy.recovery_do: Store authenticator backup codes offline and secure your email with its own two-factor authentication.
privacy.recovery_dont: Share passcodes or IDs over unsecured channels; always use the official support form.
withdrawal_policy: ACH-funded bitcoin unlocks between 10 and 30 days depending on the purchase size and your account history.
Wire deposits and inbound bitcoin typically unlock within about 24 hours after the trade completes.
USD wire withdrawals incur a $15 fee and require a $50,000 minimum per transfer.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_do: Check the Available to withdraw banner before scheduling a large withdrawal or auto-withdraw trigger.
privacy.withdrawal_policy_dont: Expect on-chain withdrawals to leave immediately if the underlying ACH is still in its unlock window.
region: Swan serves all 50 U.S. states and supports select international clients through Swan Private with BitGo custody.
ACH funding and Swan Safe remain limited to U.S. checking accounts that support ACH transfers.

micro_faqs.q: Does Swan sell my personal data?
micro_faqs.a: No. Swan states it never sells customer data and only shares with advertising partners when you opt in via the cookie banner.

micro_faqs.q: How do I adjust my privacy settings?
micro_faqs.a: Visit swan.com/privacy-policy to review or change cookie and data sharing choices at any time.

micro_faqs.q: Where is my bitcoin held while I wait to withdraw?
micro_faqs.a: Your bitcoin sits with regulated custodians Bakkt, BitGo, or Equity Trust until you move it to your own wallet.

glossary.def: The consent pop-up that lets you opt in or out of optional analytics and advertising data sharing.
Client assets are held in individually titled accounts, never commingled with Swan’s corporate funds.
Two-factor authentication such as an authenticator app or passkey used to secure logins and withdrawals.

cards.fact: Segregated accounts with Bakkt, BitGo, and Equity Trust
Swan Guard security overview and roadmap
